1.text: Wisdom has built her house. She has carved out her seven pillars.

2.text: She has prepared her meat. She has mixed her wine. She has also set her table.

3.text: She has sent out her maidens. She cries from the highest places of the city:

4.text: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” As for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,

5.text: “Come, eat some of my bread, Drink some of the wine which I have mixed!

6.text: Leave your simple ways, and live. Walk in the way of understanding.”

7.text: He who corrects a mocker invites insult. He who reproves a wicked man invites abuse.

8.text: Don’t reprove a scoffer, lest he hate you. Reprove a wise man, and he will love you.

9.text: Instruct a wise man, and he will be still wiser. Teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.

10.text: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom. The knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

11.text: For by me your days will be multiplied. The years of your life will be increased.

12.text: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself. If you mock, you alone will bear it.

13.text: The foolish woman is loud, Undisciplined, and knows nothing.

14.text: She sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

15.text: To call to those who pass by, who go straight on their ways,

16.text: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here.” as for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,

17.text: “Stolen water is sweet. Food eaten in secret is pleasant.”

18.text: But he doesn’t know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
